required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Gain More Information on How Safe and Effective Jivi Works in Patients With Severe Hemophila A (Post-marketing Investigation)
clinical_study.official_title: Post-marketing Investigation (PMI) to Assess Safety and Efficacy of Jivi (BAY 94-9027) Treatment in Participants With Hemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: The goal of this study is to give gather more information on how safe and well Jivi works in patients with severe hemophilia A. Jivi has been approved by various regulatory agencies, including the FDA, Health Canada, Japanese Health Authority and the European Medicinal Agency. 25 patients will be enrolled and will stay for 1 to 2 years in this study depending on their treatment frequency. Researcher will monitor during the course of the study whether patients are developing antibodies (a protein made by the body in response to the drug) affecting the effectiveness of Jivi. In addition information on bleedings and patient's wellbeing will be collected.

primary_outcome.measure: FVIII inhibitor development by the Nijmegen Bethesda assay

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)

arm_group.description: Prophylactic treatment regimens should be guided by clinical judgement based on individual patient characteristics and treatment response.

intervention.description: The recommended starting dose is every 5 days treatment (45 IU/kg)- An assessment of response to treatment will be performed at the next scheduled visit after 10-15 ED (8-10 weeks). Participants may be assigned to different dosing regimens (every 7 days or 2x/week) or continue with every 5 days regimen, according to individual bleeding tendency and needs at investigator's discretion.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants must ≥ 18 years of age inclusive, at the time of signing the informed consent.
- Participants with severe hemophilia A (FVIII: C<1%)
- PTPs (Previously treated patients) (≥150 ED (Exposure day)) on prophylaxis treatment before enrollment
- Participants who are immunocompetent. If human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) positive, cluster of differentiation 4 (CD4)+ lymphocyte count >200/mm*3
- Participants who are willing to complete an eDiary
- Male participants
- Capable of giving signed informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any other inherited or acquired bleeding disorder in addition to Hemophilia A.
- Platelet count < 100,000/mm*3
- Creatinine > 2x upper limit of normal
- AST or ALT > 5x upper limit of normal (AST: aspartate aminotransferase; ALT: alanine aminotransferase)
- The participant has a planned major surgery.
- The participant is currently participating in another investigational drug study, or has participated in a clinical study involving an investigational drug within 30 days of signing informed consent or previous treatment in a clinical phase III study with BAY 94-9027 (now marketed as Jivi).
- Current evidence (by central laboratory) or history of inhibitor to FVIII with a titer ≥ 0.6 Bethesda unit (BU).
- Known hypersensitivity to the drug substance, excipients, or mouse or hamster protein.

facility.name: Fondazione Policlinico Universitario Agostino Gemelli IRCCS
Ciutat Sanitària i Universitaria de la Vall d'Hebron
Hospital Universitari i Politècnic La Fe

patient_data.ipd_description: Availability of this study's data will be determined according to Bayer's commitment to the EFPIA/PhRMA "Principles for responsible clinical trial data sharing". This pertains to scope, timepoint and process of data access. As such, Bayer commits to sharing upon request from qualified researchers patient-level clinical trial data, study-level clinical trial data, and protocols from clinical trials in patients for medicines and indications approved in the US and EU as necessary for conducting legitimate research. This applies to data on new medicines and indications that have been approved by the EU and US regulatory agencies on or after January 01, 2014. Interested researchers can use www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com to request access to anonymized patient-level data and supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct research. Information on the Bayer criteria for listing studies and other relevant information is provided in the Study sponsors section of the portal.
